attributes.action: Introduce newborn screening for Spinal Muscular Atrophy in the UK immediately.
attributes.additional_details: The National Screening Committee reviewed ‘real world data’ and suggested the introduction of screening would save 2.9 babies lives a year.
attributes.background: There are three treatments currently available for Spinal Muscular Atrophy on the NHS. All require treatment to commence prior to symptoms commencing in order to achieve the best outcome.

rejection.details:
There is a petition already open on this subject which you can sign:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/755980
